physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:105 x 146 mmCondition:The print is in good condition, though the mounting paper is heavily foxed and crumbling.Foliation:‘14’Process:Silver gelatin

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:View from the old fort on Hormuz Island (perhaps the Fort of Our Lady of the Conception, also known as the Portuguese Castle) towards a settlement, likely Hormuz itself. All the structures are low-lying stone buildings with wooden or reed roofs.Craggy hills rise in the background at right and the shoreline curves away into the distance. A flagstaff left of centre may denote the presence of the British agency. A dhow is anchored at far left and several figures can be seen along the shoreline at left.This is the second (left-hand) image in a panoramic pair taken from the same position. The first is Photo 49/1/13.Inscriptions:Ink, below image: 'General View, Hormuz.’Pencil, lower right, alongside image: ‘14’Pencil, upper left, alongside image: ‘b’
